channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The CEO of Deutsche Bank's asset-management subsidiary DWS will step down, a day after a raid by German authorities on its Frankfurt offices https://t.co/NjaQS4SBZL
K-Pop boy band BTS met with President Biden at the White House to talk about discrimination against the Asian community amid an uptick in anti-Asian hate crimes in the U.S. https://t.co/G4QM2j43Lx
Russia is getting oil to market by using ship-to-ship transfers and tapping Indian refineries to hide the origins of gasoline and other products https://t.co/44D4sH5mil
French Laundry chef Thomas Keller on his guilty pleasure: “In-N-Out Burger. I always order the French fries well-done, so they get crispy.” https://t.co/WWvREZkDxq

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said his country won’t surrender any territory to Russia in exchange for peace, despite losing terrain and soldiers daily to Moscow’s forces https://t.co/bNtzAlh76f
A surgeon lost his life savings. Others have given up on their dreams. All of them were swept up in crypto mania—and the crash. https://t.co/46uPnq152i
Goodbye, sweatpants; hello, dress pants. A clear signal from apparel retailers reporting results lately is that customers are finally starting to dress like adults again. https://t.co/igmGBZYQDh

New York lawmakers said they would increase the minimum age to buy a semiautomatic rifle to 21 years old from 18 under legislation to tighten gun laws following mass shootings in Buffalo and Uvalde, Texas https://t.co/DR5q2IfZE2
Israel and the U.A.E. signed a free-trade agreement, boosting business ties less than two years after they established formal diplomatic relations https://t.co/ap49AqyO2b

Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic have one of tennis’s most celebrated rivalries. At the French Open Tuesday night, the two legends played a clay court epic, with Nadal prevailing in four sets to move onto the semifinals, writes @jasongay https://t.co/mv5r5Ou5hW
K-Pop boy band BTS met with President Biden at the White House to talk about discrimination against the Asian community amid an uptick in anti-Asian hate crimes in the U.S. https://t.co/InZNnVjCys
President Biden and Fed Chairman Powell are meeting as the U.S. economy faces the highest inflation in 40 years https://t.co/uS54IrKlYQ

Pulse oximeters are less accurate among Black, Hispanic and Asian Covid-19 patients than for white patients, a study showed, underscoring the shortcomings of a critical device used to monitor for the disease’s riskiest outcomes https://t.co/dkh3v0TBfx

Peter Navarro, a top White House official under former President Donald Trump, said FBI agents served him with a subpoena last week demanding that he testify before a grand jury this week on efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election https://t.co/GPoOMh74Bv

A lawyer for the 2016 Clinton campaign, Michael Sussmann, was acquitted on a charge of lying to the FBI about his motives for bringing the bureau research allegedly linking Donald Trump to Russia https://t.co/2QgksYAVXC
European Union leaders said they would impose an oil embargo on Russia, taking a big step forward in the economic fight against Moscow #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/6zzMXCftzV https://t.co/chSv8Fq7bC
“Popcorn supply will be tight.” That’s a scary script for movie theaters worried about shortages behind the concession stand—just as Americans are returning to the cinema. https://t.co/R4q0QqWjk6

President Biden’s commitment that the U.S. will defend Taiwan further erodes a decades-old policy of ambiguity on how Washington would respond to a Chinese attack on the island https://t.co/t8uuDgdVbF

Two Russian soldiers were found guilty of firing rockets indiscriminately toward civilian areas in Ukraine’s second war crimes trial since the invasion. They were each sentenced to 11 years and six months in prison. https://t.co/BEDvUN7iIk

The Biden administration plans to provide Ukraine with a guided-rocket system capable of hitting targets from a distance of more than 40 miles, according to U.S. officials, roughly twice the range of the M777 howitzers that the U.S. has provided https://t.co/QIvSgdGXAd
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/0KYybd6q7Q https://t.co/PP6xUsuM1a

The American West is locked in a historic drought, bringing renewed water restrictions, fire danger and angst to one of the nation’s fastest-growing regions—just as the heat of summer approaches https://t.co/KDTA74BWqg

Ukraine is accusing Russia of using thermobaric weapons—whose powerful blasts can unleash a devastating toll on people and buildings—in the latest battle for the Donbas area of eastern Ukraine. https://t.co/ZhjyZr387T

Boston escapes a bruising seven-game series with Miami, and now faces a rested and rebuilt Golden State in the NBA Finals. Sports columnist @JasonGay on the matchup, which begins Thursday. https://t.co/gaXM7TNSHd
“I wouldn’t wish this on anyone.” Funeral events began Monday in Uvalde, Texas, for the victims of the school shooting. https://t.co/FGa9ZmS3fl
A 20-minute drive from the Las Vegas Strip is a repository for some of the most coveted military secrets of the Cold War, known to visitors as the “petting zoo” https://t.co/AW7vGSVhG5

A group of under-the-radar commodity traders are cashing in on Russian oil, stepping in to buy and transport crude to customers as their bigger rivals retreat from the market #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/NSr0jmBhCH https://t.co/jzR0yxKVX6

European Union leaders gathering in Brussels Monday sought to maintain unity against Russia and its invasion of Ukraine despite internal divisions over a proposed oil embargo on Moscow and differences over how much military equipment to provide Kyiv https://t.co/ink1ki7E96
French Laundry chef Thomas Keller on his guilty pleasure: “In-N-Out Burger. I always order the French fries well-done, so they get crispy.” https://t.co/nekp3hDUxR

Review: “Top Gun: Maverick” is half videogame, half car commercial, which may be exactly what audiences want from their big-screen experience now—frictionless storytelling with special effects. https://t.co/vaCtPacZu0

For people with disabilities, the trauma of war is magnified. Shattered routines provoke extreme stress. Those with sensory hypersensitivity find sirens, raised voices and explosions particularly jarring. Physical problems make escape harder. https://t.co/sp5GPsHmT0
Canada is introducing some of the toughest gun-control measures in decades, including a ban on the purchase, sale and transfer of handguns https://t.co/paQlkpdnuk
A lack of workers means pools, restaurants are cutting hours. “What, no one is applying?” https://t.co/9iKxVxrXZo
“Top Gun: Maverick,” the long-awaited sequel to the 1986 hit, set a box-office record for Memorial Day weekend and a career-best debut for its star, Tom Cruise https://t.co/U3bITrulCf
For the first time, scientists have identified the entire genetic makeup of a victim of the deadly Mount Vesuvius eruption nearly 2,000 years ago https://t.co/mSNETgQQt6
Lumber prices have come crashing down, in a new sign of how rising interest rates are deflating markets that boomed during the pandemic https://t.co/65yT33YG7A
The U.S. plans to spend $7.5 billion to help build out a charging network for electric vehicles. Experience suggests it will be a difficult task. https://t.co/zdXocT2NSb
See the most glamorous looks from the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival, including Anne Hathaway and Tom Cruise https://t.co/vEhnWFr3hS
One person was killed and seven others were wounded in a shooting early Sunday at an outdoor festival in Oklahoma https://t.co/AgTrO7D4Fn

When a Wall Street Journal reporter tested positive for Covid while covering the Olympic Games in Beijing, she became one of a small number of Americans to experience China’s aggressive zero-Covid policies. https://t.co/Fga96fAO4x
A big shift is under way in women's sports. Stars like soccer player Alex Morgan are successfully pushing for better pay and more support. https://t.co/3lkvp0lt0x
A surgeon lost his life savings. Others have given up on their dreams. All of them were swept up in crypto mania—and the crash. https://t.co/MOtmGOc0fj
“I was told there would be no math in this ad” is essentially how many consumers react to percentage claims from marketers https://t.co/MKRSHMcMTD

Draconian Covid restrictions are feeding a sense of despair among many younger residents of Chinese cities, who are now rethinking plans for careers, marriage, and kids: “We are the last generation.” https://t.co/qN3UWjjCna
‘Top Gun: Maverick’ proved too pro-American for one Chinese investor, which backed out of the film amid mounting U.S.-China tensions https://t.co/mGEjULmjfK
Inflation is as old as Rome and ancient China. Until the 18th century, governments didn’t know what to call it, let alone what to do about it. https://t.co/bvfUoN6mzD

A tech billionaire brought down plans by Australia’s biggest polluter to spin off its coal-fired power plants into a new company, handing a big win to environmental activists who want a faster shift toward cleaner energy https://t.co/RQrwCbdemK

Mourners have gathered at makeshift memorials in Uvalde, where a row of 21 empty chairs—19 child-sized ones and two larger ones—face a church: “The whole town just feels broken. I don’t know when it will stop feeling this way, or if it ever will.” https://t.co/av0VG6JKJd
In the new “Top Gun” movie, is Glen Powell’s Hangman more like Val Kilmer’s Iceman or Tom Cruise’s Maverick? Either way, he’s a full throttle jerk. https://t.co/4vdsvavp2z

“You think this can’t happen to you but it can.” Parents are increasingly alarmed about the dangers of fentanyl as overdose deaths rise, and are having difficult conversations to try and keep their kids safe. https://t.co/yiI6MLP2eU
